channel.title: Some questions.. rep or rsgp if you can answer
channel.description:
how do you maximize effective arrow pick up and speed?
If you wanted to find a color that’s more to the middle of the screen, what would be the fastest way?
when trying to make an action with an item that has hundreds of colors and they always change, what do you do? I NEED to know
when ur mining, how do you make it so SCAR knows when the rock is gone?
What are SCAR "Scripting Standards"
what are forms and how they can be used??
What are cases?
What is another way of writing Wait( )?
What’s the difference between a function and a procedure?
What’s the different between inttostr and strtoint and what do they stand for? (what the fuck are these?)
What is a main loop and how the hell do you use it?
What is an interscar message and hows it used??
What are the ways of making comments in SCAR?
Give me an example (a script) that uses a function I dont get this?
If there was a script you were making, and you wanted to make it so its like: if theres something there that you want, then go for it, if there isn't, than do something else - how would you do it? I REALLY don't understand this :(
If you can help with any of these ill give rep or rs gp i really need to learn this stuff

item.title: Some questions.. rep or rsgp if you can answer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok, here’s a script with good scripting standards:

begin
WriteLn(‘Hello.’);
if(This)then
Dostuff;
end.

Here’s a script with bad standards:

begin
writeln(‘Hello.’);
if(this)then
dostuff;
end.

Basically it’s just indenting your program and adding caps, I use if This then, but it dosen’t mean bad standards, it all boils down to style of coding. Scripting standards and comments help people read your code, and understand what it does.

And item?

Read full topic

item.title: Some questions.. rep or rsgp if you can answer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok basically it’s this.

FindColorSpiralTolerance(var x,y: Integer; color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer; Tolerance: Integer)

The x, y are the coords the color is if it finds it(basically if it finds the color, it returns true and x, y are set to the coords of the color)

The color is the color we are searching for, and tolerance is well, how diffrent the color can be. (I suggest 5-15 depending on how often the color changes).

Here’s an example

If we’re searching for color 1337, and tolerance is 2, it will search for

1335, 1336, 1337, 1338, 1339.

Here’s a small diagram of xs, ys, xe, ye.

xs, ys
_>____
| |
| |
|___| <- xe, ye

And xs, ys are the first coords picked, xe, ye can be the second, you have 4 coords and a box.

Scripting standards are just basically spaces in your script. You don’t need to worry about this just yet.

Read full topic
item.source: Some questions.. rep or rsgp if you can answer

link me pleaseeeeee

PS: FindColorSpiralTolerance(bla) is the COMPLETE answer this is what makes it work? (bla)

What are SCAR “Scripting Standards”

Just scripting standards. Search around for them.

Please list them or link me? :\ I dont understand

Read full topic
item.source: Some questions.. rep or rsgp if you can answer

item.title: Some questions.. rep or rsgp if you can answer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

bubbles2088:

how do you maximize effective arrow pick up and speed?

Make a script and say put a const for arrow colour then a procedure to find that colour, and if the uptext is “pickup” or somthing along those lines, then click.

bubbles2088:

If you wanted to find a color that’s more to the middle of the screen, what would be the fastest way?

Try FindColorSpiralTolerance(bla), the xs, ys, xe, ye are explained on the forums, do a bit of searching.

bubbles2088:

when trying to make an action with an item that has hundreds of colors and they always change, what do you do? I NEED to know

Try tolerance? You didn’t explain this question very well.

bubbles2088:

when ur mining, how do you make it so SCAR knows when the rock is gone?

Try to make a procedure to see if the uptext is mine and the colour is a colour of a mined rock. Not that hard.

bubbles2088:

What are SCAR “Scripting Standards”

Just scripting standards. Search around for them.

bubbles2088:

what are forms and how they can be used??

Forms in my opinion are just fancy const. You can use them more than just a const, search in the tutorial section for a good description by Mad Cow on them.

bubbles2088:

What are cases?

case VARORSOMTHING of
1 : Writeln(‘lol’);
end;

bubbles2088:

What is another way of writing Wait( )?

Sleep( );

bubbles2088:

What’s the difference between a function and a procedure?

A function returns somthing. FindColor is a function, if it finds the color it returns true, if it dosen’t it returns false.

bubbles2088:

What’s the different between inttostr and strtoint and what do they stand for? (what the fuck are these?)

IntToStr converts a integer to a string. IntToStr(1) Will give you ‘1’ in a string form. StrToInt converts a string to an integer. MAKE SURE THE STRING IS ALL INTEGER THOUGH!

bubbles2088:

What is a main loop and how the hell do you use it?

program new;

procedure Blah;
begin
end;

begin
Blah;
end.

The procedure “Blah” is called in the main line, in this example.

bubbles2088:

What is an interscar message and hows it used??

InterScarMessage is just a way of comunicating between 2 scripts on 1 pc, see the f1 manual for a description.

bubbles2088:

What are the ways of making comments in SCAR?

{ } (more than one line)
// (one line)
(* *) (more than one line)

bubbles2088:

Give me an example (a script) that uses a function I dont get this?

function ReturnInt : integer;
begin
Result := 1;
end;

begin
Writeln(IntToStr(ReturnInt));
end.

bubbles2088:

If there was a script you were making, and you wanted to make it so its like: if theres something there that you want, then go for it, if there isn’t, than do something else - how would you do it? I REALLY don’t understand this

Here’s a small example, experiment with it.

const
Hello = ‘hi’;

begin
if Hello = ‘yo’ then
Writeln(‘yay’)
else
Writeln(‘boo!’);
end.

Enjoy!

Read full topic
